abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated as marginally
            unsatisfactory. Overall sustainability is assessed as likely
            for those project components rated as satisfactory. Overall
            World Bank performance was satisfactory. Borrower
            performance overall is considered marginally unsatisfactory
            because the deficiencies in the government's
            implementation had such a negative effect on the achievement
            of project objectives. There are three main lessons gleaned
            from this project experience: 1) The Export Development
            Support Program needs exceptionally sound administration
            when provided on a loan basis. 2) Soon after project
            effectiveness, there was a serious financial sector crisis
            and then a recession. In these circumstances, it was
            virtually impossible for the credit line to achieve its goal
            of increasing term intermediation. Although macroeconomic
            instability was clearly discussed in the country analysis
            section of the Staff Appraisal Report, it should have been
            set out in the report's risk section. Mid-term reviews
            in particular should carefully review the influence, past
            and prospective, of the macroeconomic environment on project
            performance. 3) The ability of a credit line to increase
            term lending is problematic. Aside from the fact that
            macroeconomic conditions worsened once again, in retrospect
            it seems evident that domestic financial institutions would
            be reluctant to lend on a long-term basis unless they also
            could obtain funds of a similar tenure.
